abstract: Britain recorded 71,140 hate crimes in 2015-2016 financial year, suggesting growing number of hate crimes in country; Mark Hamilton, who leads Britain's hate crime policy for National Police Chiefs' Council, asserts number is representative of increase in reporting of hate crimes, not actual rise in number of assaults.

headline.print_headline: Britain’s Increase in Hate Crimes Is Tied to Changes in Reporting
headline.main: Britain’s Increase in Hate Crimes Is Tied to Changes in How They Are Reported

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The rise can be attributed to increased public awareness and changes in British law stemming from a perception-based definition of what constitutes a hate crime....
lead_paragraph: The rise can be attributed to increased public awareness and changes in British law stemming from a perception-based definition of what constitutes a hate crime.
